# Standard Deviation

> [Lévy][levy] distribution [standard deviation][standard-deviation].


<!-- Section to include introductory text. Make sure to keep an empty line after the intro `section` element and another before the `/section` close. -->

<section class="intro">

The [standard deviation][standard-deviation] for a [Lévy][levy] random variable with location `μ` and scale `c > 0` is

<!-- <equation class="equation" label="eq:levy_stdev" align="center" raw="\sigma = \infty" alt="Standard deviation for a Lévy distribution."> -->

</section>

<!-- /.intro -->

<!-- Package usage documentation. -->

<section class="usage">

## Usage

``` javascript
var stdev = require( '@stdlib/math/base/dist/levy/stdev' );
```

#### stdev( mu, c )

Returns the [standard deviation][standard-deviation] for a [Lévy][levy] distribution with location parameter `mu` and scale parameter `c`.

``` javascript
var y = stdev( 2.0, 1.0 );
// returns Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY

y = stdev( 0.0, 1.0 );
// returns Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY

y = stdev( -1.0, 4.0 );
// returns Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY
```

If provided `NaN` as any argument, the function returns `NaN`.

``` javascript
var y = stdev( NaN, 1.0 );
// returns NaN

y = stdev( 0.0, NaN );
// returns NaN
```

If provided `c <= 0`, the function returns `NaN`.

``` javascript
var y = stdev( 0.0, 0.0 );
// returns NaN

y = stdev( 0.0, -1.0 );
// returns NaN
```

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<!-- Package usage examples. -->

<section class="examples">

## Examples

``` javascript
var randu = require( '@stdlib/math/base/random/randu' );
var stdev = require( '@stdlib/math/base/dist/levy/stdev' );

var mu;
var c;
var y;
var i;

for ( i = 0; i < 10; i++ ) {
    mu = ( randu()*10.0 ) - 5.0;
    c = randu() * 20.0;
    y = stdev( mu, c );
    console.log( 'µ: %d, c: %d, SD(X;µ,c): %d',
        mu.toFixed( 4 ),
        c.toFixed( 4 ),
        y.toFixed( 4 )
    );
}
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->
